intro: Conostephium prolatum, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant produces small, tubular yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Conostephium prolatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
